flawed_nl_solution:
If Natasha has $60, which is 3 times as much money as Carla, Carla has $60/3=$<<60/3=20>>20
Together, Carla and Natasha have $20+$60=$<<20+60=80>>80
Carla has twice as much money as Cosima, meaning Cosima has $20/2=$10
Combined, the three have $10+$80=$<<10+80=90>>90
If they buy goods with the amount they have and sell at 7/5 of the buying price, the total amount of money they will get from selling the goods is 7/5*90=$<<7/5*90=149.04>>149.04
If they earn $149.04 from the sale of the goods they bought with the money they had, their profit is $149.04-$90=$<<149.04-90=59.04>>59.04

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 125.99999999999999, not 149.0404604168. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
